column4: hello there, i noticed that the latest version of openoffice is 2.1, can i get this version using apt-get?
how can i check in the backport repo?
then it isnt backported. any good reason to have it?
i read that the developers of this release really recommend to have it as it had many new and upgraded features
if you realy need them youll have to package and install it yourself
if that version is too old, try the backports repo
is there some good reason for wanting the latest version - some new killer must have feature?
not really i just want to try it, i didn't know it is a big deal!
it isnt. :) i just want to point out that using bleeding edgy software for the sake if it is bound to break sometime. :) best keep to the (reasonably) well tested versions in the repos
that is, unless there is some new feature/bugfix that is a real must have...
